_header: O gracious Princess good and fair
Title(s): ‘Of the same James quhen he hed plesett him’
Subjects: patronage, pleas for; Dog, James, keeper of the Queen’s Wardrobe
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Of the same James [Dog, keeper of the Queen’s Wardrobe] quhen he hed plesett him’ — six quatrains (aabb) including refrain: ‘He is na dog he is a lam’

CULLl510.First Lines:
O gratious princes gude and fairDo well to James ȝour
                    wardrapair…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…That neuer dollour mak him dramHe is na dog he is ane
                    lam

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
O gracious princes guid and fairdo weill to Iames ȝour
                    wardraipair…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…That newir dolour mak him dramhe is na dog he is an
                    Lam
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Author:
quod dunbar of þe said Iames quhen he had plesett him (p.
                    340)
